alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 09 at 11:36AM EST until January 09 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northwest North Carolina, including the following areas, Alleghany NC, Ashe, Watauga and Wilkes and southwest Virginia, including the following area, Grayson. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen since early this morning. In addition to a large area of moderate rain that will continue over the area through the afternoon, a narrow band of intense rainfall will cross the area before 6PM. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
